item.title: Pentagon asked to probe SpaceX for potential Chinese ownership
item.description: Two Democratic US senators urged the Pentagon on Thursday to conduct an immediate review of SpaceX amid allegations that Chinese investors have secretly acquired stakes in the closely held rocket maker, citing potential national security risks, according to a letter seen by Reuters. Senators Eliza

item.title: Gold price drops by Tk7,640 per bhori in Bangladesh
item.description: Gold prices in Bangladesh have been reduced by Tk7,640 per bhori on Friday, following a fresh price revision announced by the Bangladesh Jewellers Association (BAJUS). The association explained that the decision was taken in view of an overall assessment of the market situation, particularly a fal

item.title: Tension near Jamuna as protesters demand 9th pay scale
item.description: Tension flared up near Jamuna, the official residence of the Chief Adviser, on Friday as protesters staged demonstrations demanding the immediate implementation of the 9th national pay scale. Mohammad Moniruzzaman, officer-in-charge (OC) of Shahbagh Police Station, said a protest procession of gov

item.title: JS polls, referendum preparations complete: Anwarul Islam
item.description: Election Commissioner Md Anwarul Islam Sarker has said that all preparations of the Election Commission (EC) for the 13th Jatiya Sangsad (JS) Elections and Referendum, scheduled for February 12, have been completed. "Now there is no preparation left except for the voters to go to the polling

item.title: Police use batons, sound grenades on govt workers protesting in front of Jamuna
item.description: Police have fired tear gas and sound grenades at government employees who were protesting in front of the State Guest House Jamuna, the official residence of the Chief Advisor, to demand the publication and implementation of the 9th pay scale gazette in light of the National Pay Commission’s

item.title: Effigies of Adviser Sakhawat, BIDA’s Ashik, among others burnt at DU
item.description: Effigies of several individuals were burned at Dhaka University on Thursday in protest against the government’s move to lease the New Mooring Container Terminal (NCT) of Chattogram Port to foreign entities, branding them as 'economic hitmen'. The demonstration was held in the afternoon at th

item.title: Mild cold wave grips four districts
item.description: A mild cold wave is sweeping over the Moulvibazar, Panchagarh, Rajshahi and Pabna districts, the Bangladesh Meteorological Department says. Meteorologist Shahnaz Sultana told bdnews24.com on Friday afternoon that the cold wave may continue in the four districts on Saturday, with little temperature

item.title: BNP declares 51-point manifesto to build ‘welfare-oriented, prosperous Bangladesh’
item.description: BNP chief Tarique Rahman is announcing the party’s 51-point election manifesto, prioritising nine issues with the promise of “building a welfare-oriented and prosperous Bangladesh”. The party chairman presented the manifesto at the Pan Pacific Sonargaon Hotel in Dhaka on Friday a

item.title: JUCSU Vice President Jitu joins Chhatra Dal
item.description: Abdur Rashid Jitu, vice president of the Jahangirnagar University Central Students Union, has joined the BNP. Alongside him, several other student representatives have also joined the BNP’s student affiliate, the Jatiotabadi Chhatra Dal. They officially joined at an event at the BNP’s

item.title: Bangladesh, Japan sign historic EPA
item.description: Bangladesh and Japan on Thursday signed a historic Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA), marking a major milestone in their bilateral ties and giving duty free access to 7,379 Bangladeshi products to the Japanese market. This is the first time Bangladesh has signed an Economic Partnership Agreemen

item.title: Hazlewood injury adds to Australia’s T20 World Cup woes
item.description: Australia’s T20 World Cup campaign has suffered a severe blow just five days before their opening match, with pace bowler Josh Hazlewood officially ruled out of the tournament due to injury. The news comes as a double blow for the 2021 champions, who had already lost Test and ODI captain Pat

item.title: Vote manipulators to face consequences like fascists: Nahid
item.description: National Citizen Party (NCP) Convener Nahid Islam on Friday warned that anyone attempting to steal votes or commit election fraud will face consequences similar to those faced by fascists.
